item.title: Sinkhole starting, 13th December
item.description:
Think this might be the start of a sink hole. It’s been filled in here loads of times but this seems different and more sunk .

item.title: Fallen / felled tree completely blocking path. Dangerous to access path, 13th December
item.description:
Follow Cotswold way past postlip hall farm and take the public footpath to the isbourne way. Access to this path is completely blocked.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe

item.title: Excessive Mud on road, 13th December
item.description:
Local company seem to be taking wood away from the area of Cleeve Common have left an excessive amount of mud on road and completely damaged the already wet verges . Total distance covers about 2 miles of public highway from Car Park at West Downs to quarry at Syreford
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold

item.title: Sustained damage problem, 13th December
item.description:
Good morning, The post showing the parking restriction rules outside number 48 Hall Road has been damaged recently. It's bent right over. It’s closer to the school end.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in road surface posing a serious hazard to cyclists, 13th December
item.description:
The pothole is about 5 yards from the traffic island on Thirlestaine Road, near the exit gateway from Cheltenham College swimming pool. Problem reported twice in the last 2 months but still no action taken. The pothole is getting deeper and wider on a daily basis and is a serious risk to cyclists. Please repair it as soon as possible..
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterfield Close, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking wide vehicle access from our farm, 13th December
item.description:
The owner of the property has blocked access of pull ins on our narrow woolstone road with the use of boulders. These are right on the roadside and we cannot get our vehicles through to farm access. This is going to cause an accident.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: In Church Road close to the church car park entrance. It goes across the road - a trench poorly repaired by a utilities Co, 13th December
item.description:
There are several "small" potholes around the mini-roundabouts by the Church (already shown as reported) but another potentially large one is beginning to appear. A few weeks ago a utilities Co dug a trench across Church Road but the filling in and tarmac repair is extremely poor and has been breaking up from day 1. This is getting worse by the day near what is a very busy traffic junction not helped by the level of illegal lorry traffic still using Church Road into Innsworth Lane as access to the trading estate and house building in Innsworrh - I acknowledge that restrictions were "signed-up" regarding such traffic but who in reality polices it?? The larger pothole I outline is becoming worse by the day and clearly needs attention so that a serious accident particularly involving bicycles is avoided. I would remind you that both Infants and Junior schools are close by thus increasing traffic flow and the potential for issues arising.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hand rail vandalised, 12th December
item.description:
